integrations_researched.name: Next.js
integrations_researched.description: Full-stack React framework for building the web dashboard with both frontend UI and backend API routes

api_patterns.initialization: npx create-next-app@latest my-app --yes (includes TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, ESLint, App Router)
key_functions: GET(request: NextRequest) - Route handler for GET requests
POST(request: NextRequest) - Route handler for POST requests
'use server' directive - Server actions for data mutations
revalidatePath('/path') - Cache revalidation
redirect('/path') - Server-side redirects

gotchas: Node.js 20.9+ required
App Router is the default (not Pages Router)
context.params is now a Promise in v15+
Server Actions use POST method and 'use server' directive

integrations_researched.name: React
integrations_researched.description: UI library for building component-based interfaces (bundled with Next.js)

key_functions: useState(initialValue) - Component state management
useEffect(callback, deps) - Side effects handling
useTransition() - Non-blocking state updates
useActionState(action, initialState) - Form/action state management
memo(Component) - Memoization for performance

infrastructure.notes: Client-side rendering with server components support in Next.js

gotchas: Components must be pure (same input = same output)
Follow Rules of Hooks (only call in component body)
'use client' directive needed for client components in Next.js App Router

integrations_researched.name: Tailwind CSS
integrations_researched.description: Utility-first CSS framework for styling the dashboard

key_functions: Utility classes: flex, grid, p-4, m-2, text-lg, bg-blue-500
Responsive: sm:, md:, lg:, xl: prefixes
Dark mode: dark: prefix
Hover states: hover:, focus:, active: prefixes

infrastructure.notes: Build-time CSS generation, no runtime overhead

gotchas: Tailwind v4 uses @import 'tailwindcss' instead of @tailwind directives
Configure content paths in tailwind.config.ts for purging
Use CSS-in-JS or inline styles for dynamic values

integrations_researched.name: Node.js fs Module
integrations_researched.description: Built-in Node.js module for file system operations - scanning project directories

api_patterns.initialization: No initialization needed - built into Node.js
key_functions: readdir(path, { withFileTypes: true }) - List directory contents with Dirent objects
stat(path) - Get file/directory stats (size, mtime, isDirectory)
watch(path, { recursive: true }) - Watch for file changes
opendir(path) - Open directory for async iteration

infrastructure.notes: Built-in module, works in Node.js environment (Next.js API routes)

gotchas: Promise-based APIs recommended for non-blocking operations
Use withFileTypes option to distinguish files from directories
fs.watch may have platform-specific behavior
Cannot use in client components - only server-side (API routes, Server Actions)

integrations_researched.name: simple-git
integrations_researched.description: Git operations library for detecting project git status, branches, and recent commits

verified_package.name: simple-git
verified_package.verification_note: Package name verified from npm registry, API patterns from established usage

key_functions: git.status() - Get working directory status (modified, staged, untracked files)
git.log({ maxCount: 10 }) - Get recent commit history
git.branch() - Get branch information
git.remote(['get-url', 'origin']) - Get remote URL
git.checkIsRepo() - Verify if directory is a git repository

gotchas: Requires git CLI installed on the host system
Must check if directory is a git repo before operations
Some operations may fail on empty repositories
All methods return Promises

integrations_researched.name: shadcn/ui
integrations_researched.description: Accessible, customizable React component library for building the dashboard UI

verified_package.name: shadcn-ui
verified_package.verification_note: CLI-based component installation, not traditional npm package

imports: import { Table, TableBody, TableCell, TableHead } from '@/components/ui/table'
api_patterns.initialization: npx shadcn@latest init (then add components: npx shadcn@latest add button card table)
key_functions: Button variants: default, destructive, outline, secondary, ghost, link
Card components: Card, CardHeader, CardTitle, CardDescription, CardContent, CardFooter
Table components: Table, TableHeader, TableBody, TableRow, TableHead, TableCell
Badge for status indicators

infrastructure.notes: Components are copied to your project, fully customizable

gotchas: Components are installed into your codebase (not npm dependencies)
Requires Tailwind CSS to be configured
Each component may have Radix UI peer dependencies
Run 'npx shadcn@latest add [component]' to add specific components

integrations_researched.name: Lucide React
integrations_researched.description: Icon library for visual indicators (used with shadcn/ui)

verified_package.name: lucide-react
verified_package.verification_note: Commonly used with shadcn/ui, well-established package

imports: import { Folder, GitBranch, Clock, CheckCircle, AlertCircle } from 'lucide-react'
api_patterns.initialization: No initialization needed - import icons directly
key_functions: Icons as React components: <Folder className='w-4 h-4' />
Size via className: w-4 h-4, w-6 h-6, etc.
Color via className: text-green-500, text-red-500

gotchas: Import only icons you need for smaller bundle size
Use className for sizing (not size prop in all cases)
Compatible with Tailwind CSS utility classes

recommendations.recommendation: Use Next.js App Router with TypeScript
recommendations.reason: Provides both frontend and backend in one project with type safety. Server Actions eliminate need for separate API layer for simple operations.

recommendations.recommendation: Use JSON file for project metadata persistence
recommendations.reason: Simpler than SQLite for this use case. Can store in project root as projects.json. No database setup required.

recommendations.recommendation: Detect project state from git status and file markers
recommendations.reason: Use simple-git for git status (uncommitted changes, branch info). Check for common markers: package.json, README.md, .gitignore, TODO files.

recommendations.recommendation: Use shadcn/ui Card component for project cards
recommendations.reason: Provides consistent, accessible UI. Card component with Badge for status works well for at-a-glance view.

recommendations.recommendation: Configure projects directory path via environment variable
recommendations.reason: PROJECTS_DIR env var allows flexibility. Default to ~/Documents/Projects if not set.

recommendations.recommendation: Consider file:// links or VS Code URI for project navigation
recommendations.reason: Browser can open file:// links (limited by security). VS Code URI (vscode://file/path) opens directly in editor.

data_persistence.notes: Simple file-based storage, no database needed
